subject: Re: [junit] Can we have multiple runs for a single  test method of the Unit test case

messageBody:
Mohan,

Generally, this is tackled using the Parameterized Test Case pattern. It's
described well in Rainsberger's book "JUnit Recipes", but here's a recent
example from the list (thanks, Elliotte). Share and Enjoy,

David Saff

import junit.framework.*;
import junit.textui.TestRunner;

public class DataDrivenTest extends TestCase{

int i;

public DataDrivenTest(int i) {
super("testFoo");
this.i = i;
}

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite result = new TestSuite();
result.addTest(new DataDrivenTest(1));
result.addTest(new DataDrivenTest(2));
result.addTest(new DataDrivenTest(3));
return result;
}


public void testFoo() {
assertTrue(i > 0);
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
TestRunner.run(suite());
}
}
